titleStmt.title: Miklós Oláh to Ferenc Thurzó and Hungarian Chamber (Vienna, 23 November 1551)

seriesStmt.title: Bibliotheca Scriptorum Medii Recentisque Aevorum: Series nova

note.p: Notes: Original, partly autograph letter with signature and seal.
On the outer side: De moderatione censurae camerae dominus cancellarius scribit, inquisitionem fieri petit.

div.head: Miklós Oláh to Ferenc Thurzó and Hungarian Chamber (Vienna, 23 November 1551)

body.p: 1. The censura that the Chamber sent in connection with István Dobó’s administration did not take into consideration what Oláh had already tried to make them understand before. Oláh has therefore stayed here in Vienna and did not follow the King, and he spent three days working on revising the censura and wrote a mitigation that follows the articuli to accompany it. He has sent it to them so they can see why he may have been lenient with Dobó. 2. He asks them to read his mitigation as soon as possible and decide in the case while the King returns to Vienna; royal constrascriba Péter Gutai will help them with it. He has also written to Dobó to prepare and send the annual accounting for the year 1551. György Kachich will tell them the rest. 3. They should inform Oláh about their intentions as soon as possible, so he can find a suitable inspector. Although he is sending this letter to Ferenc Thurzó as well, he has heard that he has not returned to Bratislava yet, so they should decide without him.

div.p: Reverendi ac Egregii Domini, Fratres et Amici Honorandi, salutem et nostri condation commendationem !

[1.] Censuram, quam superioribus temporibus Dominationes Vestrae super administratione Stephani DoboIstván Dobó. ad nos miserant, quamvis prius cognoscere atque nostram superinde opinionem Dominationibus Vestris describere voluerimus, praesentia tamen maiestatis regiae ac alia publica regni negotia, quae privata nostra negotia intermittere nos compulserunt, non sunt passa nos rebus nostris privatis invigilare, sed eas ad aliud tempus reiicere et relinquere coegerunt, atque ideo ea saltem ratione hic Viennae mansimus et ne suam maiestatem hac vice in itinere sequeremur. A sua maiestate obtinuimus, ut iamtandem rebus quoque nostris privatis prospicere possemus, post discessum itaque suae maiestatis censuram ipsam per tres fere dies laborando diligenter revidimus ac nostram quoque moderationem secundum articulos descripsissemus. Quam pro faciliori inventione secundum capita articulorum cifris notatam unacum nostra opinione ac moderatione similiter cifris notata, nec non duobus regestis super inquisitione et rectificatione conscriptis per egregium Georgium litteratum Katthyth,The Croatian Kachich family was famous around this time, see Petrichevich Horváth 1941, 226. cuius opera in hac revisione usi sumus, Dominationibus Vestris remisimus, si qua in re nos servitori nostrosnostro indulsisse perspexerint, id non in aliam partem interpretari velint, nisi quod in ea moderatione limites aequitatis transcendere noluimus, et quod rationem etiam temporis ac loci, ubi Dobo officium exercuit, habuimus.

[2.] Quare Dominationes Vestras rogamus diligenter, velint, quantocitius fieri poterit, nostram moderationem cognoscere atque haec negotia primo quoque tempore expedire, ut interim, quoad maiestas regia ex GracioGrecioGraz. rediens hic Viennae pausabit et se ad alias regiones non movebit, totius negotii finis per nos atque Dominationes Vestras imponi possit. Videtur autem ad inquisitionem eiusmodi negotiorum pro parte camerae regiae maiestatis sufficiens esse Petrus litteratus Gwtthensis,Péter Gutai was Counter-signer (contrascriba) of Eger between 1549–1558, after which he became Royal Controller (1557–1563), see Kenyeres 2006, 60–61. modernus in arce Agriensi contrascriba regius, cui et nos ex nostris aliquem pro commodiori inquisitione adiungemus. ScripsimusWe do not know this letter. etiam Stephano Dobo, ut rationes quoque anni praesentis 1551 quamprimum conficere ac nobis vel Dominationibus Vestris mittere curet, ut eo citius totum rationis dandae negotium perfici possit. Cetera Dominationes Vestrae fusius a praedicto Georgio litterato cognoscent per quem Dominationibus Vestris seorsum et privatim, et communiter quoque nuntiavimus. Quas optamus valere feliciter.

[3.] Censuram Dominationum Vestrarum cum nostra moderatione conferant faciantque unum corpus responsionis ad rationes Dobonis dandae. Quae postea illic tempore eo, quo videbitur fore commodius, mitti poterit, faciant itaque Dominationes Vestrae me de voluntate earum quamprimum certiorem, ut possim designare hominem aliquem meum idoneum ad inquisitionem similcum contrascriba fidelem faciendam. Has licet litteras licet adscribi iusserim etiam ad domino Nitriensi,Ferenc Thurzó. arbitratus eum Posonii esse, sed quia audio nondum eum rediisse Posonium, Dominationes Vestrae velint sine eo negotio huic finem imponere rogo. Quae feliciter valeant.

div.head: On the outer side:
div.p: Reverendis ac egregiis dominis Francisco Thwrzo de Bethlenffalwa, episcopo Nittriensi praefecto ac ceteris consiliariis Hungaricae camerae regiae maiestatis etc. dominis fratribus et amicis honorandis.
